etymology.interpretation: Combines the sense of “excess” with “sensitivity” to indicate an abnormally heightened reaction, typically to allergens. Common in phrases like 过敏体质 and 过敏反应.
etymology.simplification: “过” was simplified from “過” by replacing the complex phonetic component, reducing strokes; “敏” is unchanged.

parts.english: to pass; to cross; to exceed; overly/too

examples.chinese: 我对花粉过敏(我對花粉過敏)。
医生问我是否对药物过敏(醫生問我是否對藥物過敏)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng wèn wǒ shìfǒu duì yàowù guòmǐn.
examples.english: The doctor asked whether I am allergic to any medication.

examples.chinese: 他吃了花生后过敏(他吃了花生後過敏)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chī le huāshēng hòu guòmǐn.
examples.english: He had an allergic reaction after eating peanuts.
